topic.title: I can not publish a web page
topic.body:
Hello,

I have created a web page on my computer (in zeronet).
And on the other computer he joined the web site via a zeronet. (But for an hour I still get the same error)
https://image.ibb.co/dXsgsR/CRRR.png

1604066297_mirrored_tomas06_github.body:
When I do that, I get these 3 reports.

Content published to 0/5 peers.
Content publish failed.
No peers found, but your content is ready to access.

Does that have to wait 5 peers on my page to send her?

Publish through the button or via the command is the same?

through "commands" it does not work.
https://pastebin.com/raw/1dwUrmiX (Successfuly published to 0 peers)

but on the other computer, I still see:

Connecting...
No peers found
content.json download failed
Peers found: 1
content.json download failed
Peers found: 1
content.json download failed

as a second computer I used a virtualbox...

I did a video to illustrate my problem.
https://streamable.com/q4x41

Thank you.

This is a test page... there is no problem when somebody gets the keys...
But thank you for the alert....

"Your port 15441 is closed, but your Tor gateway is running well."
That is the problem?

PS:
as i sent there is also some error: https://pastebin.com/raw/1dwUrmiX
"Tor, due to Tor proxy port 127.0.0.1:9050 check error"
I do not use Tor connection.

On the main page xxx I see: Port: Closed Tor: Available


I see this information on the page I want to share:
Missing files:
content.json

the file "content.json" exists in the folder "1111iB2JPb8usyJnzRVtwZQGag866F7n"

Hmmm Hmmm.
Suddenly, it all works :-D

PS:
So the "content.json" file itself does not use its own site (only use-clients)?

I don't understand how, but now everything works immediately..
Thank you help and your patience.
